Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/abs
Synopsis Absolute value of a numeric value.
Function &T <: num abs(&T <: num n)
Description Absolute value of the number n. The result type is equal to the type of the argument n.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>abs(13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(-13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(3.14)
real: 3.14
rascal>abs(-3.14)
real: 3.14

The type of abs(15.23024476065474800) is

Question 3. 
abs(-20) ==

Question 4. 
abs(-14.534786716457405650) ==
